Sentencas: S-substituted La2Mo2O9 were synthesized by a solid-state procedure employing ammonium sulfate (NH4)(2)SO4 as a sulfur source.
Titulo: New Synthetic Route for Reaching Higher Phase Stabilization in LAMOX-Based Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The synthesized powders were examined using X-ray diffraction (XRD), thermogravimetric analysis (TGA), infrared, and Raman spectroscopies.
Titulo: New Synthetic Route for Reaching Higher Phase Stabilization in LAMOX-Based Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The results divulged that the stabilization of the beta-La2Mo2O9 polymorph occurred in the interval of sulfur composition 0.1 <= y <= 0.6.
Titulo: New Synthetic Route for Reaching Higher Phase Stabilization in LAMOX-Based Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: This substitution generates a linear dwindling of the unit cell volume.
Titulo: New Synthetic Route for Reaching Higher Phase Stabilization in LAMOX-Based Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The decomposition of all substituted samples started above 900 degrees C with a total weight loss linearly dependent on the sulfur content.
Titulo: New Synthetic Route for Reaching Higher Phase Stabilization in LAMOX-Based Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Electrical studies confirmed that substituting S6+ for Mo6+ suppresses the phase transition of La2Mo2O9 and stabilizes the cubic polymorph down to ambient temperature.
Titulo: New Synthetic Route for Reaching Higher Phase Stabilization in LAMOX-Based Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: It was also remarkable that this substitution caused a decrease in the conductivity, and unfortunately, none of the tested compositions allowed exceeding the conductivity of La2Mo2O9.
Titulo: New Synthetic Route for Reaching Higher Phase Stabilization in LAMOX-Based Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Infrared and Raman spectra confirmed the presence of the characteristic peaks of sulfates and molybdates groups.
Titulo: New Synthetic Route for Reaching Higher Phase Stabilization in LAMOX-Based Electrolyte for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
